modals.script: First, go to the Permissions menu and select 'Set'

You're in 'Network' view. The router at the top shows all the 
    devices connected to it.

Double-click a device to target it and see data packets traveling
     between it at the router. You can also target yourself.

Targeting a device brings you to 'Sniffer' view. You can go back
    'Network' view by clicking 'Network' on the upper left-hand side.

Click on some packets. If a packet is sent over an HTTP
    connection, you'll be able to see its contents when you click on it.

Open a browser and navigate to 'http://itp.eveweinberg.com/flat'. 
    Fill out the form you find there. Then, come back to look for the 
    highlighted packet.

Did you find it? Look through the packet data. Can you find the 
    Response Code? [link to Wikipedia about Response Codes] Can you find the data 
    you submitted in the form?

Now, in the browser, navigate to 'https://kaganjd.github.io/https-form'. 
    Do the same thing as before: Fill it out and come back to find the 
    highlighted packet.

Did you find it? You probably notice that you can't see as much information 
    as before. That's because packets sent with HTTPS only reveal packet metadata [ 
    link to Wikipedia about metadata ], like host name; all of the actual packet 
    data is encrypted, so we can't see it.
Congrats! You completed the packet exercise.
